alert.note: Alert for Bienville; De Soto; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Red River (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 11:11PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern De Soto, Red River, northwestern Natchitoches, Bienville and southwestern Lincoln Parishes through 1145 PM CDT... At 1111 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dubberly to near Ringgold to 14 miles southwest of Heflin to 7 miles northeast of Mansfield to 7 miles northeast of Logansport. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mansfield, Arcadia, Coushatta, Ringgold, Gibsland, Martin, South Mansfield, Hall Summit, Saline, Lucky, Ashland, Castor, Grand Cane, Edgefield, Bienville, Jamestown, Bryceland, Mount Lebanon, Carmel and Grand Bayou. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northwestern Louisiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; De Soto; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Red River
